main_definition: Much is an adverb used to indicate a large amount, degree, or extent of something.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to compare two things and express that one has a greater quantity than the other
meanings_and_examples.example: I have much more experience in this field compared to you.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicates a high level or degree of something
meanings_and_examples.example: She knows the subject matter much better than anyone else in the room.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Expresses that an action is done to a great extent or with a lot of effort
meanings_and_examples.example: He worked on this project much more than any other assignment I've seen him do.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used in negative sentences to intensify the negativity
meanings_and_examples.example: I don't like that restaurant at all, and the food is much worse.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to emphasize a positive statement or question
meanings_and_examples.example: You must be joking! That would be much too good to be true!
